alert.note: Alert for Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 31 at 3:35AM MST until January 01 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Niobrara County, Wyoming including Lusk. The northern Nebraska Panhandle including Chadron, Alliance, and Harrison. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 11 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: A wind chill advisory means that the combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Wear appropriate clothing outside if outside. Cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands.
